workflow.name: Track brand mentions with sentiment analysis using Bright Data & OpenAI
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

This workflow automatically tracks brand mentions across various online platforms by scraping blog posts and articles for specific brand references. It saves you time by eliminating the need to manually search for brand mentions and provides sentiment analysis on how your brand is being discussed online.

## Overview

This workflow automatically scrapes Medium blog posts and other online content to find mentions of specific brands (like OpenAI) and performs sentiment analysis on the content. It uses Bright Data to access content without restrictions and AI to intelligently extract brand-related information, analyze sentiment, and summarize key points about brand coverage.

## Tools Used

- **n8n**: The automation platform that orchestrates the workflow
- **Bright Data**: For scraping blog posts and articles without being blocked
- **OpenAI**: AI agent for intelligent content analysis and sentiment extraction
- **Google Sheets**: For storing brand mention data and sentiment analysis results

## How to Install

1. **Import the Workflow**: Download the .json file and import it into your n8n instance
2. **Configure Bright Data**: Add your Bright Data credentials to the MCP Client node
3. **Set Up OpenAI**: Configure your OpenAI API credentials
4. **Configure Google Sheets**: Connect your Google Sheets account and set up your brand monitoring spreadsheet
5. **Customize**: Define target URLs and brand keywords to monitor

## Use Cases

- **Brand Monitoring**: Track how your brand is mentioned and discussed online
- **Public Relations**: Monitor media coverage and public sentiment about your brand
- **Competitive Intelligence**: Track mentions of competitor brands and market perception
- **Crisis Management**: Quickly identify negative brand mentions for rapid response

## Connect with Me

- **Website**: https://www.nofluff.online
- **YouTube**: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
- **LinkedIn**: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
- **Get Bright Data**: https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25 (Using this link supports my free workflows with a small commission)

#n8n #automation #brandmonitoring #sentimentanalysis #brightdata #webscraping #brandmentions #n8nworkflow #workflow #nocode #mediamonitoring #brandtracking #publicrelations #brandanalytics #onlinemonitoring #contentanalysis #brandsentiment #digitalmonitoring #brandresearch #mediaanalysis #brandinsights #reputationmanagement #brandwatch #socialmediamonitoring #contentmonitoring #brandpresence #digitalpr #brandlistening #mediatracking #onlinereputation

parameters.text:
=scrape the below medium blog URL and do setimant analysis:
{{ $json.blogURL }}

parameters.content:
## üîπ SECTION 1: Start the Workflow & Provide Input

üß© Nodes:

* üîò When clicking 'Execute workflow' ‚Üí ‚úÖ Renamed: Start Manually
* üìù Edit Fields (Manual Input) ‚Üí ‚úÖ Renamed: Set Medium Blog URL

üí° What This Does:
You start the workflow manually and provide the blog post URL from Medium. This is done using a simple field, so no coding is needed.

üìå Example:
You paste a Medium blog URL like:

```
https://medium.com/some-author/the-future-of-openai-in-ai-innovation-abc123
```

üîç Why It‚Äôs Useful:

* üß† You can analyze any blog post from Medium.
* üßë‚Äçüíº Great for researchers, marketers, or founders tracking OpenAI mentions in the blogosphere.

üéØ Beginner Tip:
Just click ‚ñ∂ Execute, then paste your Medium URL when prompted!

## ü§ñ SECTION 2: AI Agent Fetches & Filters Content

üß© Main Node:

* ü§ñ AI Agent ‚Üí ‚úÖ Renamed: Scrape Blog for OpenAI Mentions

üîß Sub-Nodes Connected:

* üß† OpenAI Chat Model ‚Üí Processes your goal (e.g., ‚ÄúFind OpenAI mentions‚Äù)
* üåê MCP Client (Tool: scrape\_as\_markdown) ‚Üí Actually visits and scrapes the Medium post
* üßæ Structured Output Parser ‚Üí Formats the scraped content into clean, structured data

üí° What This Does:
This is the powerhouse of your workflow! Here's what happens:

1. The AI Agent receives your input (blog URL and goal).
2. It activates a special scraping tool via Bright Data MCP called scrape\_as\_markdown.
3. The AI intelligently finds paragraphs or sections that mention OpenAI.
4. The result is then parsed into structured, easy-to-read text.

üîç Why It‚Äôs Useful:

* üî¨ No more reading entire blogs manually‚Äîget only the content that matters.
* üß† Uses ChatGPT to understand meaning, not just raw keyword match.
* üïµÔ∏è Perfect for media monitoring, market research, and trend tracking.

üéØ Beginner Tip:
You don‚Äôt need to worry about scraping or code. The AI + MCP handle everything behind the scenes!

## üìä SECTION 3: Store the Results in Google Sheets

üß© Node:

* üìÑ Google Sheets (Append Row) ‚Üí ‚úÖ Renamed: Save to Google Sheets

üí° What This Does:
Once the filtered and formatted content is ready, it is automatically saved into your connected Google Sheet.

üìå What Gets Saved:

* Blog title or URL
* Extracted paragraphs that mention OpenAI
* (Optional) Date or time for historical tracking

üìä Why It‚Äôs Useful:

* üìÅ Centralized content in one place
* üìà Enables easy data tracking, comparison, or sharing
* ‚úÖ Great for building automated research reports

üéØ Beginner Tip:
You can open the Google Sheet any time to view the results ‚Äî no export needed!

# üß†Track Brand Mentions Across Platforms

This automation scrapes a Medium blog post (you provide the URL) and pulls out content that mentions OpenAI, then stores it into Google Sheets.

Let‚Äôs break it down by sections ‚¨áÔ∏è

---

## üîπ SECTION 1: Start the Workflow & Provide Input

üß© Nodes:

* üîò When clicking 'Execute workflow' ‚Üí ‚úÖ Renamed: Start Manually
* üìù Edit Fields (Manual Input) ‚Üí ‚úÖ Renamed: Set Medium Blog URL

üí° What This Does:
You start the workflow manually and provide the blog post URL from Medium. This is done using a simple field, so no coding is needed.

üìå Example:
You paste a Medium blog URL like:

```
https://medium.com/some-author/the-future-of-openai-in-ai-innovation-abc123
```

üîç Why It‚Äôs Useful:

* üßë‚Äçüíº Great for researchers, marketers, or founders tracking OpenAI mentions in the blogosphere.

üéØ Beginner Tip:

---

## ü§ñ SECTION 2: AI Agent Fetches & Filters Content

üß© Main Node:

* ü§ñ AI Agent ‚Üí ‚úÖ Renamed: Scrape Blog for OpenAI Mentions

üîß Sub-Nodes Connected:

* üß† OpenAI Chat Model ‚Üí Processes your goal (e.g., ‚ÄúFind OpenAI mentions‚Äù)
* üåê MCP Client (Tool: scrape\_as\_markdown) ‚Üí Actually visits and scrapes the Medium post
* üßæ Structured Output Parser ‚Üí Formats the scraped content into clean, structured data

üí° What This Does:
This is the powerhouse of your workflow! Here's what happens:

1. The AI Agent receives your input (blog URL and goal).
2. It activates a special scraping tool via Bright Data MCP called scrape\_as\_markdown.
3. The AI intelligently finds paragraphs or sections that mention OpenAI.
4. The result is then parsed into structured, easy-to-read text.

üîç Why It‚Äôs Useful:

* üî¨ No more reading entire blogs manually‚Äîget only the content that matters.
* üß† Uses ChatGPT to understand meaning, not just raw keyword match.
* üïµÔ∏è Perfect for media monitoring, market research, and trend tracking.

üéØ Beginner Tip:
You don‚Äôt need to worry about scraping or code. The AI + MCP handle everything behind the scenes!

---

## üìä SECTION 3: Store the Results in Google Sheets

üß© Node:

* üìÑ Google Sheets (Append Row) ‚Üí ‚úÖ Renamed: Save to Google Sheets

üí° What This Does:
Once the filtered and formatted content is ready, it is automatically saved into your connected Google Sheet.

üìå What Gets Saved:

* Blog title or URL
* Extracted paragraphs that mention OpenAI
* (Optional) Date or time for historical tracking

üìä Why It‚Äôs Useful:

üéØ Beginner Tip:

---

## ‚úÖ Summary: Why This Workflow Rocks

| Feature                   | Benefit                             |
| ------------------------- | ----------------------------------- |
| üîó Input Any Blog         | Works on any Medium URL             |
| üß† AI + Bright Data MCP   | Smart & human-like scraping         |
| üîé Focused on ‚ÄúOpenAI‚Äù    | Filters only relevant content       |
| üìä Saves to Google Sheets | Easy analysis, no manual copy/paste |

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "platform": "Blog",
  "author": "Sam Enfield",
  "title": "Why OpenAI Suddenly Erased Jony Ive from their Website",
  "content summary": "The article discusses a vanished partnership between OpenAI and Jony Ive, Apple's legendary designer behind iconic products like the iMac, iPod, iPhone, iPad, and Apple Watch. The collaboration aimed to create a sleek, intuitive AI consumer device dubbed the \"iPhone of artificial intelligence,\" backed by billions in funding and design philosophy from Apple. However, all traces of this collaboration suddenly disappeared online‚Äîblog posts, announcement videos, promotional pages, and introductions were deleted or wiped clean. The article reveals that this abrupt removal is linked to a trademark lawsuit that emerged, reshaping the future of AI.",
  "sentiment": "Negative"
}
